        Check if a given directory is a git repository.
        Parameters:
        targetDirectory - The directory to check.
        Returns:
        true if the directory is a git repository, false if not.

                                      String remoteGitUrl)

        Parameters:
        targetDirectory - The directory to check.
        remoteGitUrl - expected remote origin url
        Returns:

      • cloneOrCheckout

        public static void cloneOrCheckout(Path targetDirectory,
                                   String repositoryUrl,
                                   String branch,
                                   String localDirectory)
        Clone or checkout a git repository in a local directory relative to the given targetDirectory.
        Parameters:
        targetDirectory - The root directory that will contains the localDirectory in which to checkout the archives.
        repositoryUrl - The url of the repository to checkout or clone.
        branch - The branch to checkout or clone.
        localDirectory - The path, relative to targetDirectory, in which to checkout or clone the git directory.

      • cloneOrCheckout

        public static org.eclipse.jgit.api.Git cloneOrCheckout(Path targetDirectory,
                                                       String repositoryUrl,
                                                       String username,
                                                       String password,
                                                       String branch,
                                                       String localDirectory)
        Parameters:
        targetDirectory - The root directory that will contains the localDirectory in which to checkout the archives.
        repositoryUrl - The url of the repository to checkout or clone.
        username - The username to use for the repository connection.
        password - The password to use for the repository connection.
        branch - The branch to checkout or clone.
        localDirectory - The path, relative to targetDirectory, in which to checkout or clone the git directory.

      • pull

        public static boolean pull(org.eclipse.jgit.api.Git repository,
                           String username,
                           String password)
        Trigger a Pull Request on an existing repository.
        Parameters:
        repository - The git repository to pull.
        username - The username to use for the repository connection.
        password - The password to use for the repository connection.
        Returns:
        True if the pull request has updated the data, false if the repository was already up to date.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The hash of the last commit.

      • getHistory

        public static List<SimpleGitHistoryEntry> getHistory(Path repositoryDirectory,
                                                     int from,
                                                     int count)
        Return a simplified git commit history list.
        Parameters:
        repositoryDirectory - The directory in which the git repo exists.
        from - Start to query from the given history.
        count - The number of history entries to retrieve.
        Returns:
        A list of simplified history entries.

                             String remoteName,
                             String remoteUrl)
        Set a remote repository path.
        Parameters:
        repositoryDirectory - The directory in which the git repo exists.
        remoteName - The name of the remote (i.e. 'origin')
        remoteUrl - The url of the repository.

                           String username,
                           String password)
        Git push to a remote.
        Parameters:
        repositoryDirectory - The directory in which the git repo exists.
        username - The username to use for the repository connection.
        password - The password to use for the repository connection.
        Returns:
        Returns true pushed, false otherwise.

        Parameters:

        localBranch - The name of the local branch.

      • push

        public static boolean push(org.eclipse.jgit.api.Git git,
                           String username,
                           String password,
                           String localBranch,
                           String remoteBranch)
        Git push to a remote.
        Parameters:
        git - The git repository.
        username - The username to use for the repository connection.
        password - The password to use for the repository connection.
        localBranch - The name of the local branch to push.
        remoteBranch - The name of the remote branch to push to.
        Returns:
        true pushed, false otherwise.

      • pull

        public static void pull(Path repositoryDirectory,
                        String username,
                        String password)
        Pull modifications from the default branch a git repository.
        Parameters:
        repositoryDirectory - The directory in which the git repo exists.
        username - The username for the git repository connection, null if none.
        password - The password for the git repository connection, null if none.

      • pull

        public static void pull(Path repositoryDirectory,
                        String username,
                        String password,
                        String remoteBranch)
        Pull modifications a git repository.
        Parameters:
        repositoryDirectory - The directory in which the git repo exists.
        username - The username for the git repository connection, null if none.
        password - The password for the git repository connection, null if none.
        remoteBranch - The name of the remote branch to pull from.
